body: Would you write your environment? Thank you!

Look at my pull request( #1287) for a quick fix. @walsripe 
Maybe it gets merged in time.

> Look at my pull request( #1287) for a quick fix. @walsripe
> Maybe it gets merged in time.

Hello, I installed the Doccano on myself Ubuntu by using Docker and modified the file you mentioned in the commit. But, it seems that the problem also remains. Thus, I would like to know whether you could give me a brief description of how you did?

Many thanks. I also tested on sequence labelling project. The outputs are as below.

The project looks like:

![project](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26459647/113631310-2c0d5f00-9661-11eb-8465-5e9dfe3c17d9.png)

The config I modified looks like:

![config](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26459647/113631377-48a99700-9661-11eb-9d60-bdbc9ca2a64b.png)

The output without text label:

![withouttext](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26459647/113631432-60811b00-9661-11eb-9526-3ca11c256c73.png)

The output with text label:

![withtext](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26459647/113631465-6c6cdd00-9661-11eb-9106-cca69400e661.png)

I am not sure why the modified config didn't work, or maybe I missed some key points?

I ran into this problem today as well!
I believe it worked for one export or something like that, and then hasn't worked since. Would be very happy to get a fix

Edit : This is for doing the text extraction task (NER) btw

Thanks for the quick reply. I can't really tell why its not working for you, but you could check if the right format arrives at the TextDownloadView.
You can print the format in the import_export.py after line 133. If it doesn't print jsonl in your terminal (where you start the server) then the wrong format parameter arrives at the view. Line 146 shows the check for the type parameter where the labels are painted. Would be interesting if that's the case. 
Sry, but that's my only suggestion for the problem rn. I have time in some days to test it further.
Hi, I have the same issue with label extraction (detailed here : https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/1267 ).

issue.title: Dataset export only exports numbers and not named text.

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
When i export my labelled dataset, the output only contains numbers and not the text names of the labels. I have used both export options and the outputs are the same. I have tried on mac and PC - the same. I have installed fresh and up-to-date and still the same issue. What am i missing here? I have seen this was a previous issue, but no answer apart from this has been solved. I am using windows 10 and python 3.9.0

thanks

body:
BTW. A in-normal quick fix of export text label is:

Just use hard coding, change the below line:
#format = request.query_params.get('q')
to
format = "jsonl"

In doccano/app/api/views/import_export.py, around line 135.

It can work if you want to export text label format, but the jsonl format export won't work anymore. If you want jsonl format, you can change it backward.


> Hi, I have the same issue with label extraction (detailed here : #1267 ).



> I ran into this problem today as well!
> I believe it worked for one export or something like that, and then hasn't worked since. Would be very happy to get a fix
> 
> Edit : This is for doing the text extraction task (NER) btw

issue.title: Improve upload and download features

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
## Upload

- [x] Support a large file upload
- [x] Support a folder upload
- [x] Support multiple files upload
- [x] Support asynchronous upload
- [x] Enable to show upload progress

## Ingestion

- [x] Support batch import to speed up the process
- [x] Support file validation
- [x] Import as much of the file's content as possible
- [x] Provide feedback on which file and what line is wrong and why.
- [x] Support 90 over encodings
- [x] Support auto encoding detection
- [x] Support saving filename

## File format

- [x] Expand the available formats
- [x] Support for specifying columns for labels and text
- [x] Support for specifying schema of CoNLL(IOB2, IOE2, IOBES, BILOU)
- [x] Support for specifying separator(CSV, CoNLL)

## Download

- [x] Support a large file download
- [x] Support asynchronous download
- [x] Support zip download
- [x] Support JSON download

## Related issues
